type.name: Position
type.text: The Position structure defines an object's position, orientation and motion.

member.name: landcell
member.text: the landcell in which the object is located

group.name: displacement
group.text: a vector describing the object's position within the landblock containing the landcell

group.name: orientation
group.text: a quaternion describing the object's orientation

group.name: velocity
group.text: a vector describing the object's velocity

type.name: Position0
type.text: A Position structure with an implied flags value of 0.

member.name: landcell
member.text: the landcell in which the object is located

group.name: displacement
group.text: a vector describing the object's position within the landblock containing the landcell

group.name: orientation
group.text: a quaternion describing the object's orientation

type.name: ModelData
type.text: The ModelData structure defines an object's visual appearance.

member.name: paletteCount
member.text: the number of palettes associated with this object

member.name: textureCount
member.text: the number of textures associated with this object

member.name: modelCount
member.text: the number of models associated with this object

member.name: offset
member.text: The number of palette entries to skip

member.name: length
member.text: The number of palette entries to copy

member.name: index
member.text: the index of the model we are replacing the texture in

type.name: PhysicsData
type.text: The PhysicsData structure defines an object's physical behavior.

member.name: byteCount
member.text: the number of BYTEs that follow

member.name: equipperSlot
member.text: the slot in which this object is equipped

member.name: equippedCount
member.text: the number of items equipped by this creature

type.name: GameData
type.text: The GameData structure defines an object's game behavior.

member.name: namePlural
member.text: plural object name (if not specified, use <name> followed by 's' or 'es')

member.name: packSlots
member.text: number of pack slots (a pack slot is a slot that may hold a pack or a foci)

member.name: approachDistance
member.text: distance a player will walk to pick up the object

member.name: usableOn
member.text: the object categories this object may be used on

member.name: iconHighlight
member.text: the type of highlight (outline) applied to the object's icon

member.name: wieldType
member.text: the type of wieldable item this is

member.name: uses
member.text: the number of uses remaining for this item (also salvage quantity)

member.name: usesLimit
member.text: the maximum number of uses possible for this item (also maximum salvage quantity)

member.name: stack
member.text: the number of items in this stack of objects

member.name: stackLimit
member.text: the maximum number of items possible in this stack of objects

member.name: container
member.text: the ID of the container holding this object

member.name: equipper
member.text: the ID of the creature equipping this object

member.name: equipPossible
member.text: the potential equipment slots this object may be placed in

member.name: equipActual
member.text: the actual equipment slots this object is currently placed in

member.name: coverage
member.text: the parts of the body this object protects

member.name: spell
member.text: the spell cast by this object

member.name: acl
member.text: the access control list for this dwelling object

member.name: hookType
member.text: what type of dwelling hook is this

member.name: hookableOn
member.text: the types of hooks this object may be placed on (-1 for hooks)

member.name: material
member.text: the type of material this object is made of

type.name: AttributeData
type.text: The AttributeData structure contains information about a character primary.

type.name: VitalData
type.text: The VitalData structure contains information about a character vital.

type.name: SkillData
type.text: The SkillData structure contains information about a character skill.

member.name: bonus
member.text: bonus points applied to this skill

type.name: CharacterPropertyData
type.text: The CharacterPropertyData structure contains character properties.

member.name: flags
member.text: determines which property types appear in the message

type.name: CharacterVectorData
type.text: The CharacterVectorData structure contains character property lists.

member.name: flags
member.text: determines which property vector types appear in the message

member.name: attributeFlags
member.text: The attributes included in the character description - this is always 0x1FF

member.name: spellbookCount
member.text: The number of spells in your Spellbook

member.name: spellbookUnknown
member.text: Probably indicates what type of data is in this section

member.name: charge
member.text: The spell's charge. Ranges from 0.0 to 1.0

member.name: lifeSpellCount
member.text: Number of Life Magic enchantments in effect.

member.name: creatureSpellCount
member.text: Number of Creature Magic enchantments in effect.

type.name: CharacterOptionData
type.text: The CharacterOptionData structure contains character options.

member.name: options
member.text: The options in the Character tab (F11 by default)

member.name: tab1Count
member.text: Number of spells in the first spelltab.

member.name: tab2Count
member.text: Number of spells in the second spelltab.

member.name: tab3Count
member.text: Number of spells in the third spelltab.

member.name: tab4Count
member.text: Number of spells in the fourth spelltab.

member.name: tab5Count
member.text: Number of spells in the fifth spelltab.

member.name: tab6Count
member.text: Number of spells in the fifth spelltab.

member.name: tab7Count
member.text: Number of spells in the fifth spelltab.

member.name: count
member.text: Number of this component for compbuyer to refill to

case.text: window property lists for each window

type.name: SourceType
type.text: Chat window string source

value.text: String is Loaded from the localization Dat

type.name: Enchantment
type.text: The Enchantment structure describes an active enchantment.

member.name: spell
member.text: the spell ID of the enchantment

member.name: layer
member.text: identifies the specific enchantment, if the same spell is applied more than once

member.name: family
member.text: the family of related spells this enchantment belongs to

member.name: elapsedTime
member.text: the amount of time this enchantment has been active

member.name: caster
member.text: the object ID of the creature or item that cast this enchantment

member.name: startTime
member.text: the time when this enchantment was cast

member.name: flags
member.text: flags that indicate the type of effect the spell has

member.name: key
member.text: along with flags, indicates which attribute is affected by the spell

type.name: FellowInfo
type.text: The FellowInfo structure contains information about a fellowship member.

member.name: shareLoot
member.text: if 0 then noSharePhatLoot, if 16 (0x0010) then sharePhatLoot

type.name: FriendsUpdateType
type.text: The type of the friend change event.

type.name: DwellingACL
type.text: The DwellingACL contains the access control list for a dwelling object.

member.name: flags
member.text: believed to be flags that control the size and content of this structure

member.name: guestLimit
member.text: Maximum number of guests on guest list (cottage is 32)

member.name: storage
member.text: 0 = dwelling access only, 1 = storage access also

type.name: DwellingItem
type.text: The DwellingItem structure contains information about a dwelling purchas or maintenance item.

member.name: pluralName
member.text: the plural name of this item (if not specified, use <name> followed by 's' or 'es')

type.name: PropertyType
type.text: The PropertyType value defines the structure and content of a property.

value.text: a vector of window property lists

type.name: PositionFlags
type.text: The PositionFlags value defines the fields present in the Position structure.

mask.text: orientation quaternion has no w component
orientation quaternion has no x component
orientation quaternion has no y component
orientation quaternion has no z component

type.name: ObjectCategoryFlags
type.text: Part one of an object's flags

mask.text: Cooking Ingredients and Supplies, Plants, Dye Pots
Alchemy Ingredients and Supplies, Oils, Dye Vials

type.name: ObjectBehaviorFlags
type.text: Flags related to the use of the item.

mask.text: adds to health, stamina or mana

type.name: AttrID
type.text: The AttrID identifies a specific Character attribute.

type.name: VitalID
type.text: The VitalID identifies a specific Character vital (secondary attribute).

type.name: CurVitalID
type.text: The CurVitalID identifies a specific Character vital (secondary attribute).

type.name: SkillID
type.text: The SkillID identifies a specific Character skill.

type.name: SkillState
type.text: The SkillState identifies whether a skill is untrained, trained or specialized.

type.name: ItemType
type.text: The ItemType specifies whether an object is a pack, a foci, or a regular item.

type.name: HookType
type.text: The HookType identifies the types of dwelling hooks.

type.name: AmmoType
type.text: The AmmoType value describes the type of ammunition a missile weapon uses.

type.name: WieldType
type.text: The WieldType value describes a wieldable item's type.

type.name: DamageType
type.text: The DamageType identifies the type of damage.

type.name: DamageLocation
type.text: The DamageLocation indicates where damage was done.

type.name: EquipMask
type.text: The EquipMask value describes the equipment slots an item uses.

type.name: CoverageMask
type.text: The CoverageMask value describes what parts of the body an item protects.

type.name: IconHighlight
type.text: The IconHighlight value describes the type of highlight (outline) applied to an icon.

type.name: AttributeHighlightMask
type.text: The AttributeHighlightMask selects which creature attributes highlighting is applied to.

type.name: ArmorHighlightMask
type.text: The ArmorHighlightMask selects which armor attributes highlighting is applied to.

type.name: WandHighlightMask
type.text: The WandHighlightMask selects which wand attributes highlighting is applied to.

type.name: WeaponHighlightMask
type.text: The WeaponHighlightMask selects which weapon attributes highlighting is applied to.

type.name: MaterialType
type.text: The MaterialType identifies the material an object is made of.

type.name: EndTradeReason
type.text: The EndTradeReason identifies the reason trading was ended.

value.text: party moved out of range or cancelled trade

type.name: ConfirmationType
type.text: The ConfirmationType identifies the specific confirmation panel to be displayed.

value.text: <text> would like to swear allegiance to you. Do you accept? (Default is No)
<text> has invited you to join their fellowship. Do you accept? (Default is No)
You determine that you have a <text> percent chance to succeed, do you wish to continue? (Default is No)

type.name: ChatMessageType
type.text: The ChatMessageType categorizes chat window messages to control color and filtering.

type.name: GroupChatType
type.text: The GroupChatType identifies the type of group chat message.

type.name: ChatDisplayMask
type.text: The ChatDisplayMask identifies that types of chat that are displayed in each chat window.

mask.text: Mandatory (main chat window only, cannot be disabled)

type.name: ChatFilterMask
type.text: The ChatFilterMask identifies types of messages that are squelched or filtered (/messagetypes).

type.name: StatusMessageType1
type.text: The StatusMessageType1 identifies the specific message to be displayed in the chat window.

value.text: You are too fatigued to attack!
You've attempted an impossible spell path!
You don't have all the components for this spell.
You don't have enough Mana to cast this spell.
You have solved this quest too recently!
You have solved this quest too many times!
You have entered your allegiance chat room.
You have left an allegiance chat room.

type.name: StatusMessageType2
type.text: The StatusMessageType2 identifies the specific message to be displayed in the chat window.

value.text: <text> is too busy to accept gifts right now.
<text> is not accepting gifts right now.
<text> doesn't know what to do with that.
You have succeeded in specializing your <text> skill!
You have succeeded in lowering your <text> skill from specialized to trained!
You have succeeded in untraining your <text> skill!
Although you cannot untrain your <text> skill, you have succeeded in recovering all the experience you had invested in it.

type.name: Effect
type.text: Audio/Visual Effect ID

value.text: Cyan Clouds Rising (Self Buff, Lifestone Recall/Tie)
Purple Clouds Rising (Focus Buff, Portal Recall/Summon/Tie)
Purple Bubbles Rising (Assessment/Tinkering Skill Buff, Learn Spell)
Blue Stars In (Mana Boost, Infuse Mana)
Blue Stars Out (Mana Drain, Drain Mana)
Orange/White Sparks (Piercing Bane, Heart Seeker, Strengthen Lock)
Orange/Black Sparks (Piercing Lure, Turn Blade, Weaken Lock)
Purple/Black Sparks (Bludgeon/Lightning Lure, Hermetic Void, Dispel)
Red Stars Out / Yellow Stars In (Health to Stamina)
Red Stars Out / Blue Stars In (Health to Mana)
Yellow Stars Out / Red Stars In (Stamina to Health)
Yellow Stars Out / Blue Stars In (Stamina to Mana)
Blue Stars Out / Red Stars In (Mana to Health)
Blue Stars Out / Yellow Stars In (Mana to Stamina)

type.name: DWORDPropertyID
type.text: The DWORDPropertyID identifies a specific Character or Object DWORD property.

value.text: Affects Vital: Amount (also Healing Kit Skill Bonus)
XP needed for next point of Vitae Penalty reduction
Augmentation: Shadow of the Seventh Mule
Augmentation: Might of the Seventh Mule
Augmentation: Enchancement of the Blade Turner
Augmentation: Enchancement of the Arrow Turner
Augmentation: Enchancement of the Mace Turner

type.name: QWORDPropertyID
type.text: The QWORDPropertyID identifies a specific Character or Object QWORD property.

type.name: BooleanPropertyID
type.text: The BooleanPropertyID identifies a specific Character or Object Boolean property.

type.name: DoublePropertyID
type.text: The DoublePropertyID identifies a specific Character or Object Double property.

value.text: Mana Rate of Change (points per second)

type.name: StringPropertyID
type.text: The StringPropertyID identifies a specific Character or Object String property.

type.name: ResourcePropertyID
type.text: The ResourcePropertyID identifies a specific Character or Object Resource property.

type.name: LinkPropertyID
type.text: The LinkPropertyID identifies a specific Character or Object Link property.

type.name: PositionPropertyID
type.text: The PositionPropertyID identifies a specific Character or Object Position property.

type.name: OptionPropertyID
type.text: The OptionPropertyID identifies a specific character option.

type.name: CharacterOptions1
type.text: The CharacterOptions1 word contains character options.

value.text: Let Other Players Give You Items
Automatically keep combat targets in view
Stay in Chat Mode after sending a Message
unused (was Play Sounds Only When Active Application)
Use Crafting Chance of Success Dialog

type.name: CharacterOptions2
type.text: The CharacterOptions2 word contains additional character options.

value.text: Allow Others to See Your Date of Birth
Allow Others to See Your Chess Rank
Allow Others to See Your Fishing Skill
Allow Others to See Your Number of Deaths
Allow Others to See Your Age
Allow Others to See Your Number of Titles
Use Main Pack as Default for Picking Up Items

type.name: TurbineChatType
type.text: The TurbineChatType identifies the type of Turbine Chat message.

type.name: ResourceType
type.text: The ResourceType identifies the dat file to be used.

type.name: CompressionType
type.text: The CompressionType identifies the type of data compression used.

type.name: GameEvent
type.text: The GameEvent identifies the meaning of the rest of the message.

value.text: Retired - Add Spell to Spellbook / Cast Spell
Failure to add a trade item

type.name: GameAction
type.text: The GameAction identifies the meaning of the rest of the message.

type.name: StanceMode
type.text: The stance for a character or monster.

value.text: melee UA weapon with no shield in attack stance
melee weapon with no shield in attack stance
melee weapon with shield in attack stance

type.name: AnimationMask
type.text: Dictates which parts of the animation packet will be present.

value.text: Secondary Animation flowed into from previous packet

type.name: AnimationType
type.text: The animation type defines the fields for the rest of the message

message.name: Destroy Object
message.text: Sent every time an object you are aware of ceases to exist. Merely running out of range does not generate this message - in that case, the client just automatically stops tracking it after receiving no updates for a while (which I presume is a very short while).

field.name: object
field.text: The object that ceases to exist.

message.name: Retired - Local Chat
message.text: Contains a message, type, person's name and source person ID. If this is local chat or spellcasting, the radar filtering is done on the client (so actually hear talking within 2 landblocks).

message.name: Retired - Attack
message.text: A player has attacked a monster (or player).

field.name: target
field.text: Object ID of the monster (or player) being attacked.

field.name: attacker
field.text: Object ID of the attacking player.

message.name: Adjust Stack Size
message.text: For stackable items, this changes the number of items in the stack.

field.name: sequence
field.text: Seems to be a sequence number of some sort

field.name: count
field.text: New number of items in the stack.

message.name: Player Killed
message.text: A Player Kill occurred nearby (also sent for suicides). This could be interesting to monitor for tournements.

field.name: text
field.text: The death message (is blank for suicides causing a blank line on your scrolling window).

field.name: killer
field.text: The ID of the character doing the killing.

message.name: Retired - Broadcast Text
message.text: Used for leather crafter and collector advertisements.

field.name: sender
field.text: Character ID of the sender - used for squelch and radar filtering.

field.name: color
field.text: Color the client uses for displaying the text.

message.name: Indirect Text
message.text: Indirect '/e' text.

field.name: sender
field.text: The ID of the character performing the emote - used for squelch/radar filtering.

field.name: senderName
field.text: Name of the character performing the emote.

message.name: Emote Text
message.text: Contains the text associated with an emote action.

field.name: sender
field.text: The ID of the character performing the emote - used for squelch/radar filtering.

field.name: senderName
field.text: Name of the character performing the emote.

message.name: Retired - Set Coverage
message.text: Sets the coverage of an object

field.name: sequence
field.text: Count of times this object has been equipped

field.name: object
field.text: The ID of the object this message refers to.

field.name: coverage
field.text: If this item can be worn or wielded, the mask of slots it occupies.

message.name: Retired - Set Character Flag
message.text: Set a flag for a character.

field.name: unknown
field.text: Possibly a sequence number, or it stays as is every time.

field.name: character
field.text: The character getting it's flags changed (including yourself).

field.name: flag
field.text: The getting changed, this may be a mask into an actual mask somewhere.

field.name: set
field.text: 1 to set the flag, 0 to clear the flag.

message.name: Retired - Set Wielder/Container
message.text: Sets the wielder/container of an object, used in equipping

field.name: sequence
field.text: Number of equips of this object

field.name: object
field.text: The ID of the object this message refers to.

field.name: container
field.text: The object that the wielder or container being being set to

message.name: Retired - Set Object Resource
message.text: set a resource for a character.

field.name: sequence
field.text: seems to be a sequence number of some sort

field.name: object
field.text: The ID of the object this message refers to.

message.name: Retired - Update Statistic
message.text: Record a stat changing

field.name: sequence
field.text: Seems to be a sequence number of some sort

message.name: Retired - Update Last Attacker
message.text: Sent whenever the last attacker changes

field.name: sequence
field.text: Seems to be a sequence number of some sort

field.name: unknown
field.text: An unknown value (0x0000000B in testing). (this seems to be a key, indicating what ObjectID is, with 0x0B being Last attacker)

message.name: Retired - Update Last Corpse Location
message.text: Sent whenever you leave a corpse (wasn't tested in a dungeon).

field.name: position
field.text: Location of the (outdoor) corpse you just left.

message.name: Retired - Skill Experience
message.text: Experience directly applied to your skill

field.name: sequence
field.text: Seems to be a sequence number of some sort

field.name: skillOffset
field.text: The offset from the attribute base.

field.name: appliedXP
field.text: experience applied towards this skill so far

field.name: bonusPoints
field.text: Bonus points given during character creation

field.name: difficulty
field.text: probably used in the xp timer calculation

message.name: Retired - Train Skill
message.text: Change training state of a skill

field.name: sequence
field.text: Seems to be a sequence number of some sort.

field.name: skillID
field.text: ID of the skill that is changing

message.name: Retired - Update Attribute
message.text: Sent every time you upgrade one of the 6 primary attributes.

field.name: NewIncrement
field.text: What this Attribute's increment is now

field.name: StartingValue
field.text: What this Attribute's value was on creation.

field.name: TotalAppliedXP
field.text: How much XP has been applied directly to this attribute.

message.name: Retired - Update Secondary Attribute
message.text: Sent every time you upgrade one of the 3 secondary attributes.

field.name: PointsAdded
field.text: Number of total points added to this attribute.

field.name: TotalAppliedXP
field.text: How much XP has been applied directly to this attribute.

field.name: NewValue
field.text: The new value of this attribute.

message.name: Retired - Vital Statistic Update
message.text: Sent whenever the current value of a vital statistic changes

field.name: sequence
field.text: Seems to be a sequence number of some sort

message.name: Creature Message
message.text: A message to be displayed in the chat window, spoken by a nearby player, NPC or creature

message.name: Creature Message (Ranged)
message.text: A message to be displayed in the chat window, spoken by a nearby player, NPC or creature

message.name: Set Character DWORD
message.text: Set or update a Character DWORD property value

message.name: Set Object DWORD
message.text: Set or update an Object DWORD property value

message.name: Set Character QWORD
message.text: Set or update a Character QWORD property value

message.name: Set Character Boolean
message.text: Set or update a Character Boolean property value

message.name: Set Object Boolean
message.text: Set or update an Object Boolean property value

message.name: Set Object String
message.text: Set or update an Object String property value

message.name: Set Object Resource
message.text: Set or update an Object Resource property value

message.name: Set Character Link
message.text: Set or update a Character Link property value

message.name: Set Object Link
message.text: Set or update an Object Link property value

message.name: Set Character Position
message.text: Set or update a Character Position property value

message.name: Set Character Skill Level
message.text: Set or update a Character Skill value

message.name: Set Character Skill State
message.text: Set or update a Character Skill state

message.name: Set Character Attribute
message.text: Set or update a Character Attribute value

message.name: Set Character Vital
message.text: Set or update a Character Vital value

message.name: Set Character Current Vital
message.text: Set or update a Character Vital value

message.name: Lifestone Materialize
message.text: Sent when a character rematerializes at the lifestone after death.

field.name: object
field.text: ObjectID of the character doing the animation

message.name: Change Model
message.text: Sent whenever a character changes their clothes. It contains the entire description of what their wearing (and possibly their facial features as well). This message is only sent for changes, when the character is first created, the body of this message is included inside the creation message.

field.name: object
field.text: The ID of character changing their clothing.

field.name: modelSequenceType
field.text: Unknown stream number. Used to sequence model changes on an object.

message.name: Retired - Server Text
message.text: Contains the text and then a number for the type (which I would expect just translates to a color).

field.name: color
field.text: The color for displaying th message.

message.name: Char Creation Initilisation
message.text: Uncracked - Character creation screen initilised.

message.name: End 3D Mode
message.text: Instructs the client to return to 2D mode - the character list.

message.name: Char Deletion
message.text: A character was marked for delete.

message.name: Request Login
message.text: The character to log in.

field.name: character
field.text: The character ID of the character to log in

field.name: zonename
field.text: The account name associated with the character

message.name: Character List
message.text: The list of characters on the current account.

field.name: characterCount
field.text: The number of characters in the list. Characters appear in the list ordered most-recently-used first, but are displayed alphabetically.

field.name: character
field.text: The character ID for this entry.

field.name: deleteTimeout
field.text: When 0, this character is not being deleted (not shown crossed out). Otherwise, it's a countdown timer in the number of seconds until the character is submitted for deletion.

field.name: slotCount
field.text: The total count of character slots.

field.name: turbineChatEnabled
field.text: Whether or not Turbine Chat (Allegiance chat) enabled.

message.name: Character Login Failure
message.text: Failure to log in

message.name: Retired - Message of the Day
message.text: The message of the day during logon. There are 2 strings, one for the number of clients connected, the second is the message of the day.

field.name: connections
field.text: The number of connections: 'Currently xxx clients connected.

field.name: message
field.text: The remaining message of the day text. As far as I can tell, the 2 strings are concatenanted (with a line break) and thrown into the text box on the login screen.

message.name: Create Object
message.text: Create an object somewhere in the world

field.name: character
field.text: ID of the character logging on - should be you.

message.name: Remove Item
message.text: Sent whenever an object is removed from the scene.

field.name: object
field.text: The character or monster who was recently erased.

message.name: Set Position and Motion
message.text: Set position - the server pathologically sends these after every actions - sometimes more than once. If has options for setting a fixed velocity or an arc for thrown weapons and arrows.

field.name: object
field.text: The object with the position changing.

field.name: sequence
field.text: A sequence number of some sort

message.name: Wield Object
message.text: Multipurpose message. So far object wielding has been decoded. Lots of unknowns

field.name: owner
field.text: id of the owner of this object

field.name: unknown3
field.text: Unknown, Some sort of an equip counter, formula used to generate it: 0x00254 | (0x40000 + 0x30000*((ConnUser[UserParsing].EquipCount - 1) / 2))

field.name: unknown1
field.text: unknown, appears to be a sequence number of some kind

message.name: Toggle Object Visibility
message.text: Signals your client to end the portal animation for you or another char and also is fired when war spells dissapear as they hit an object blocking their path.

field.name: object
field.text: The character exiting portal animation or the object that just dissapeared/appeared.

field.name: portalType
field.text: Type of portal user is exiting. For begin it's 0x4410, for end it's 0x0408, figure it out for war spell objects! :)

field.name: logins
field.text: Total times this user has logged in AC, seems to be something else for war spell objects

field.name: loginPortals
field.text: Number of portals user has entered during this login

message.name: Animation
message.text: These are animations. Whenever a human, monster or object moves - one of these little messages is sent. Even idle emotes (like head scratching and nodding) are sent in this manner.

field.name: sequence
field.text: Number of animations this login for the object

field.name: index
field.text: Number of animations, increased by one every time another f74c call is sent for that object

field.name: animation_type
field.text: Determines the type of animation that follows

field.name: sequence
field.text: The order in which this animation should be processed

field.name: target
field.text: The object that's being moved to

field.name: heading
field.text: Appears to be the heading the object is turning to

field.name: heading
field.text: Appears to be the heading the object is turning to

field.name: heading
field.text: Appears to be the heading the object is turning to

field.name: heading
field.text: Appears to be the heading the object is turning to

mask.text: This section seems to be related to jumping, but has no data that I've seen

message.name: Jumping
message.text: An object has jumped

field.name: heading
field.text: Direction you are jumping. Zero for stationary jump

field.name: logins
field.text: Number of times you've logged into AC

field.name: sequence
field.text: Number of times you've jumped since logging into AC

message.name: Apply Sound Effect
message.text: Applies a sound effect.

field.name: object
field.text: ID of the object from which the effect originates. Can be you, another char/npc or an item.

field.name: parameter
field.text: Some sort of parameter to the effect, possibly speed or color.

message.name: Enter Portal Mode
message.text: Instructs the client to show the portal graphic.

field.name: sequence
field.text: Increases by 1 or 2 each time you portal

message.name: Apply Visual/Sound Effect
message.text: Applies an effect with visual and sound.

field.name: object
field.text: ID of the object from which the effect originates. Can be you, another char/npc or an item.

field.name: speed
field.text: Speed to play the particle effect at. 1.0 is default, lower for slower, higher for faster.

message.name: Game Event
message.text: Game Events are messages that are sequenced.

field.name: character
field.text: the object ID of the message recipient (should be you)

case.text: Display a message in a popup message window.

field.name: inventoryCount
field.text: Number of items in your main pack.

field.name: type
field.text: Whether or not this object is a container. 1=unlocked container, 2=foci

field.name: text
field.text: Text detailing parts of the trade, or that trades aren't being accepted - Also is used to tell you that somebody isn't available for chat (direct/fellow/monarch/patron/vassal etc).

case.text: Returns info related to your monarch, patron and vassals.

field.name: treeParent
field.text: The Object ID for the parent character to this character. Used by the client to decide how to build the display in the Allegiance tab. 1 is the monarch.

field.name: gender
field.text: The gender of the character (for determining title).

field.name: race
field.text: The heritage of the character (for determining title).

field.name: friendsCount
field.text: The number of friends in the list

member.name: outFriendsCount
member.text: The number of people on this player's friends list

member.name: outFriend
member.text: The ID of a character on this player's friends list

member.name: inFriendsCount
member.text: The number of people who have this player on their friends list

member.name: inFriend
member.text: The ID of a character who has this player on their friends list

case.text: Store an item in a container.

field.name: item
field.text: the object ID of the item being stored

field.name: container
field.text: the object ID of the container the item is being stored in

field.name: slot
field.text: the item slot within the container where the item is being placed (0-based)

field.name: type
field.text: the type of item being stored (pack, foci or regular item)

field.name: item
field.text: the object ID of the item being equipped

field.name: current
field.text: the title ID of the currently active title

field.name: title
field.text: the title ID of an available title

case.text: Set a title for the current character.

field.name: title
field.text: the title ID of the new title

field.name: active
field.text: true if the title should be made the current title, false if it should just be added to the title list

case.text: Received when someone sends you an @tell.

field.name: sourceName
field.text: The name of the person sending you the message.

field.name: source
field.text: The character ID for the person sending you the message.

field.name: destination
field.text: The person receiving the message - which should always be you.

field.name: color
field.text: The color of the message - should always be 0x04 for normal tells, but may change if a VIP is talking to you.

case.text: Adds a spell to the spellbook. Also indicates you have cast a spell - a separate message contains the details on the spell.
Deletes a spell from the spellbook.
Contains the details for spells cast of your character.
An active enchantment has expired. Sent to update the client list and display a message.

field.name: spell
field.text: The spell copy that's begin removed.

field.name: layer
field.text: The index of this exact spell on the on the player/item. It will increment one each time the spell is cast if there is one already on the player/item.

case.text: Close Container - Only sent when explicitly closed
Open the buy/sell panel for a merchant.

field.name: merchant
field.text: the object ID of the merchant

field.name: buyCategories
field.text: the categories of items the merchant will buy

field.name: buyValue
field.text: the highest value of an item the merchant will buy

field.name: itemCount
field.text: the number of items the merchant is selling

field.name: count
field.text: the number of items for sale (-1 for an unlimited supply)

field.name: object
field.text: the object ID of the item

case.text: End Portal Storm - 'The Portal Storm has subsided' message

field.name: severity
field.text: Could be severity - was 0.40 during testing

field.name: severity
field.text: Could be severity - was 0.60 during testing

field.name: item
field.text: Item that could not be given

field.name: reason
field.text: Unknown, was 0x3EF when I tested (Zyrca: appears to be a failure reason ID)

field.name: fellow
field.text: Person who was dismissed from the fellowship

field.name: fellowCount
field.text: Number of current members in Fellowship

field.name: unknown2
field.text: unknown2, seems to be 16 (0x0010) always, could be a 'set SharePhatLoot mask' entry

field.name: shareLoot
field.text: if 0 then noSharePhatLoot, if 16 (0x0010) then sharePhatLoot

field.name: shareExp
field.text: if value==0 then share==0, if value==1 then share==percentage based on level and numberOfFellows

field.name: shareLoot
field.text: if 0 then noSharePhatLoot, if 16 (0x0010) then sharePhatLoot

field.name: fellow
field.text: Person who was dismissed from the fellowship

case.text: Sent when you first open a book, contains the entire table of contents.

field.name: object
field.text: The readable object you have just opened.

field.name: totalPages
field.text: The total number of pages in the book.

field.name: contentsPages
field.text: The number of pages that appear in the contents.

field.name: unknown1
field.text: Unknown - Always 0x3E8, may be some sort of media type.

field.name: usedPages
field.text: The number of used pages, and the number of content records.

field.name: author
field.text: The character ID of the author. For preauthored books, this value is 0xFFFFFFFF.

field.name: authorName
field.text: The character name of the author. Preauthored books often use this as a table of contents instead.

field.name: zoneAccount
field.text: The zone account name of the author (expect this to be remove in the near future - Cibo, October 20, 2000). For prewritten books, this is always 'prewritten'.

field.name: comment
field.text: The inscription comment and the book title.

field.name: commentAuthor
field.text: The author of the inscription (and not coincidentally, the book title).

field.name: commentAuthorName
field.text: The name of the inscription author.

case.text: Contains the text of a single page of a book, parchment or sign.

field.name: object
field.text: The object id for the readable object.

field.name: page
field.text: The 0-based index of the page you are currently viewing.

field.name: author
field.text: The character ID of the author. For preauthored books, this value is 0xFFFFFFFF.

field.name: authorName
field.text: The character name of the author. Preauthored books often use this as a table of contents instead.

field.name: zoneAccount
field.text: The zone account name of the author (expect this to be remove in the near future - Cibo, October 20, 2000). For prewritten books, this is always 'prewritten'.

case.text: The result of an attempt to assess an item or creature.

field.name: object
field.text: the object ID of the item or creature being assessed

field.name: protSlashing
field.text: relative protection against slashing damage (multiply by AL for actual protection)

field.name: protPiercing
field.text: relative protection against piercing damage (multiply by AL for actual protection)

field.name: protBludgeoning
field.text: relative protection against bludgeoning damage (multiply by AL for actual protection)

field.name: protCold
field.text: relative protection against cold damage (multiply by AL for actual protection)

field.name: protFire
field.text: relative protection against fire damage (multiply by AL for actual protection)

field.name: protAcid
field.text: relative protection against acid damage (multiply by AL for actual protection)

field.name: protLightning
field.text: relative protection against lightning damage (multiply by AL for actual protection)

field.name: flags1
field.text: These Flags indication which fields will be available for assess.

field.name: weapType
field.text: the type of damage done by the weapon

field.name: weapSkill
field.text: the skill used by the weapon (-1 if none)

field.name: weapDamage
field.text: the maximum damage done by the weapon

field.name: weapVariance
field.text: the maximum damage variance of the weapon

field.name: weapModifier
field.text: the damage modifier of the weapon

field.name: weapPower
field.text: the power of the weapon (this affects range)

field.name: weapAttack
field.text: the attack skill bonus of the weapon

field.name: senderName
field.text: the name of the player sending the message

case.text: Allegiance and Fellowship chats come on these messages.

field.name: senderName
field.text: The name of the character sending you the message.

field.name: container
field.text: The pack we are setting the contents of. This pack objects and the contained objects may be created before or after the message.

field.name: itemCount
field.text: Number of items in the pack (does not reflect the capacity - see the pack creation message).

field.name: type
field.text: The type of this inventory. In this message it will always be 0 since there are no subpacks currently.

case.text: Removes an item from inventory (when you place it on the ground or give it away)
An enchantment was removed (via magic item).

field.name: spell
field.text: The ID of the spell being removed.

case.text: Removes a bunch of enchantments to the list (when multiple spells expire simultaneously).

field.name: layer
field.text: Index of the spell being removed, if this index is 1 the enchantment is entirely removed.

case.text: Delete a spell from your spellbook.
Message for a death, something you killed or your own death message.

field.name: text
field.text: The text of the nearby or present death message.

case.text: Remove a bunch of enchantments in a single shot.
You have hit your target with a melee attack.

field.name: severity
field.text: the severity of the attack, scaled from 0.0 (low) to 1.0 (high)

case.text: You have been hit by a creature's melee attack.

field.name: severity
field.text: the severity of the attack, scaled from 0.0 (low) to 1.0 (high)

field.name: location
field.text: the location of the damage done

case.text: Your target has evaded your melee attack.
You have evaded a creature's melee attack.

field.name: object
field.text: the object ID of the creature

field.name: health
field.text: the amount of health remaining, scaled from 0.0 (none) to 1.0 (full)

case.text: Age Command Result - happens when you do /age in the game

field.name: unknown
field.text: Unknown - always seems to be a null string

case.text: Update Allegiance info, sent when allegiance panel is open

field.name: user
field.text: the object ID of the squelched player.

field.name: squelchMaskCount
field.text: The number of squelch masks (1=specific types, 4=all types)

field.name: name
field.text: the name of the squelched player

field.name: account
field.text: Whether this squelch applies to the entire account

field.name: filterMaskCount
field.text: The number of global filter masks (1=specific types, 4=all types)

field.name: filterMask
field.text: One of the global filter masks

case.text: Send to begin a trade and display the trade window
Item was added to trade window - you will receive a Create Object (0xF745) with details of the item

field.name: item
field.text: The item being dropped into trade window

field.name: side
field.text: Side of the trade window object was inserted (1 or 2)

case.text: Failure to add a trade item

field.name: item
field.text: Item that could not be added to trade window

field.name: reason
field.text: The numeric reason it couldn't be traded.

case.text: Buy a dwelling or pay maintenance

field.name: object
field.text: the object ID of the dwelling's covenant crystal

field.name: dwellingID
field.text: the number associated with this dwelling

field.name: owner
field.text: the object ID of the the current owner

field.name: levelReq
field.text: the level requirement to purchase this dwelling (-1 if no requirement)

field.name: rankReq
field.text: the rank requirement to purchase this dwelling (-1 if no requirement)

field.name: ownerName
field.text: the name of the current owner

field.name: purchaseCount
field.text: the number of items required to purchase this dwelling

field.name: maintenanceCount
field.text: the number of items required to pay the maintenance cost for this dwelling

field.name: purchaseDate
field.text: when the dwelling was purchased (Unix timestamp)

field.name: maintenanceDate
field.text: when the current maintenance period begain (Unix timestamp)

field.name: purchaseCount
field.text: the number of items required to purchase this dwelling

field.name: maintenanceCount
field.text: the number of items required to pay the maintenance cost for this dwelling

case.text: House Guest List, Sent in response to asking for one.

field.name: public
field.text: 0 is private house, 1 = open to public

field.name: monarch
field.text: populated when any allegiance access is specified

field.name: guestLimit
field.text: Maximum number of guests on guest list (cottage is 32)

field.name: access
field.text: 0 is just access to house, 1 = access to storage

field.name: item
field.text: the object ID of the item

field.name: mana
field.text: the amount of mana remaining, scaled from 0.0 (none) to 1.0 (full)

case.text: Display a list of available dwellings in the chat window.

field.name: landcellCount
field.text: The number of dwelling locations returned

field.name: availableCount
field.text: The total number of dwellings of this type available

field.name: type
field.text: the type of confirmation panel to display

field.name: text
field.text: text to be included in the confirmation panel message

case.text: A player has closed your confirmation panel.
Display an allegiance login/logout message in the chat window.

field.name: member
field.text: the object ID of the player logging in or out

case.text: Display a status message in the chat window.

field.name: type
field.text: the type of status message to display

case.text: Display a parameterized status message in the chat window.

field.name: type
field.text: the type of status message to display

field.name: text
field.text: text to be included in the status message

field.name: allegiance
field.text: the channel number of the allegiance channel

field.name: general
field.text: the channel number of the general channel

field.name: trade
field.text: the channel number of the trade channel

field.name: lfg
field.text: the channel number of the looking-for-group channel

field.name: roleplay
field.text: the channel number of the roleplay channel

field.name: senderName
field.text: the name of the creature sending you the message

field.name: sender
field.text: the object ID of the creature sending you the message

field.name: target
field.text: the object ID of the recipient of the message (should be you)

field.name: type
field.text: the message type, controls color and @filter processing

field.name: fellowCount
field.text: the current number of fellowship members

field.name: leader
field.text: the object ID of the fellowship leader

case.text: Add a member to your fellowship.
Add a spell to your spellbook.

field.name: spell
field.text: the spell ID of the new spell

case.text: Apply an enchantment to your character.
Remove an enchantment from your character.

field.name: spell
field.text: the spell ID of the enchantment to be removed

field.name: layer
field.text: identifies the specific enchantment, if the same spell is applied more than once

case.text: Remove multiple enchantments from your character.

field.name: count
field.text: the number of enchantments to be removed

field.name: spell
field.text: the spell ID of the enchantment to be removed

field.name: layer
field.text: identifies the specific enchantment, if the same spell is applied more than once

case.text: Silently remove all enchantments from your character, e.g. when you die (no message in the chat window).
Silently remove An enchantment from your character.

field.name: spell
field.text: the spell ID of the enchantment to be removed

field.name: layer
field.text: identifies the specific enchantment, if the same spell is applied more than once

case.text: Silently remove multiple enchantments from your character (no message in the chat window).

field.name: count
field.text: the number of enchantments to be removed

field.name: spell
field.text: the spell ID of the enchantment to be removed

field.name: layer
field.text: identifies the specific enchantment, if the same spell is applied more than once

case.text: Display a status message on the Action Viewscreen (the red text overlaid on the 3D area).

message.name: Game Action
message.text: Game Actions are outgoing messages that are sequenced.

case.text: Store an item in a container.

field.name: container
field.text: The container the item is being stored in

field.name: slot
field.text: The position in the container where the item is being placed

field.name: slot
field.text: The position in the container where the item is being placed

case.text: Spend XP to raise a vital.

field.name: xp
field.text: The amount of XP being spent

case.text: Spend XP to raise an attribute.

field.name: xp
field.text: The amount of XP being spent

case.text: Spend XP to raise a skill.

field.name: xp
field.text: The amount of XP being spent

case.text: Spend skill credits to train a skill.

field.name: credits
field.text: The number of skill credits being spent

case.text: The client is ready for the character to materialize after portalling or logging on.
Add an item to the shortcut bar.

field.name: position
field.text: Position on the shortcut bar (0-8) where the item is to be added

case.text: Remove an item from the shortcut bar.

field.name: position
field.text: Position on the shortcut bar (0-8) of the item to be removed

case.text: Add a spell to a spell bar.

field.name: position
field.text: Position on the spell bar where the spell is to be added

case.text: Remove a spell from a spell bar.

message.name: Retired - Start 3D Mode
message.text: Sent to instruct the client to login. Client changes video mode and enter's portal mode.

message.name: Enter Game
message.text: The user has clicked 'Enter'. This message does not contain the ID of the character logging on; that comes later.

message.name: Update Object
message.text: Update an existing object's data.

message.name: Turbine Chat
message.text: Send or receive a message using Turbine Chat.

field.name: size
field.text: the number of bytes that follow after this DWORD

field.name: type
field.text: the type of data contained in this message

field.name: payload
field.text: the number of bytes that follow after this DWORD

field.name: channel
field.text: the channel number of the message

field.name: senderName
field.text: the name of the player sending the message

field.name: sender
field.text: the object ID of the player sending the message

field.name: outChannel
field.text: the channel number of the message

field.name: outSender
field.text: the object ID of the player sending the message (should be you)

message.name: Start 3D Mode
message.text: Switch from the character display to the game display.

message.name: Server Message
message.text: Display a message in the chat window.

field.name: type
field.text: the message type, controls color and @filter processing

message.name: Server Name
message.text: The name of the current world.

field.name: server
field.text: the name of the current world

message.name: Update Resource
message.text: Add or update a dat file Resource.

field.name: type
field.text: which dat file should store this resource

field.name: dataSize
field.text: the number of bytes required for the remainder of this message, including this DWORD

field.name: fileSize
field.text: the size of the uncompressed file

field.name: byte
field.text: (dataSize-8) bytes of zlib compressed file data

message.name: Dat File Patch List
message.text: A list of dat files that need to be patched

field.name: revisionCount
field.text: Total number of revisions to follow

field.name: revision
field.text: The corresponding Dat file revision for this patch set

field.name: portalCount
field.text: Number of portal resources in this revision

field.name: cellCount
field.text: Number of cell resources in this revision
